words.definition: A supply of something that can be used when needed.
words.example: Water is an important resource.

words.definition: To produce a picture by making lines and marks; a game that ends with no winner.
words.example: Can you draw a cat? The match was a draw.

words.definition: With no part left out; whole.
words.example: He ate the entire cake.

words.definition: A written or spoken agreement; to decrease in size, number, or range.
words.example: They signed a contract. Muscles contract when you move.

words.definition: All the inhabitants of a particular place.
words.example: The population of the city is growing.

words.definition: The continuous physical force exerted on or against an object; to try to persuade or force someone to do something.
words.example: The pressure in the pipe is high. Don't pressure him.

words.definition: A verbal or written answer; a reaction to something.
words.example: She gave a quick response.

words.definition: A definite or clear expression in speech or writing.
words.example: The company issued a statement.

words.definition: To be unsuccessful in achieving one's goal.
words.example: He failed the test.

words.definition: To reach a place at the end of a journey.
words.example: What time will you arrive?

words.definition: Detailed examination of the elements or structure of something.
words.example: The analysis revealed new information.

words.definition: An advantage or profit gained from something; to receive an advantage.
words.example: Exercise has many health benefits. You will benefit from this.

words.definition: To take aggressive action against; an aggressive and violent action.
words.example: The army will attack at dawn. The attack was sudden.

words.definition: An area or division, especially part of a country or the world.
words.example: This region is famous for wine.

words.definition: A living organism that feeds on organic matter.
words.example: The zoo has many animals.

words.definition: To make or become better.
words.example: Practice will improve your skills.

words.definition: A piece of ground adjoining a building; a unit of linear measure equal to 3 feet.
words.example: The kids played in the yard.

words.definition: Permitted by law.
words.example: Is it legal to park here?

words.definition: A response to a question; to respond.
words.example: What is the answer? Please answer the phone.

words.definition: A definite or clear expression in speech or writing.
words.example: He made a statement to the press.

words.definition: The strength and vitality required for sustained physical or mental activity.
words.example: She has a lot of energy.

words.definition: To let or make something fall vertically; a small round or pear-shaped portion of liquid.
words.example: Drop the ball. A drop of water.

words.definition: A piece of writing included with others in a newspaper, magazine, or other publication.
words.example: I read an article about health.

words.definition: To fire a bullet or other missile from a weapon.
words.example: Don't shoot the messenger.

words.definition: The direction toward the point of the horizon where the sun rises; situated in or directed toward the east.
words.example: The sun rises in the east.

words.definition: To keep safe or rescue from harm or danger; to store for future use.
words.example: Save your work before closing the program.

words.definition: The number 7.
words.example: There are seven days in a week.

words.definition: A person who creates art, especially as a profession.
words.example: She is a talented artist.

words.definition: A place where an incident occurs or occurred; a part of a play, movie, or story.
words.example: The accident scene was chaotic.

words.definition: The goods or merchandise kept on the premises of a business or warehouse.
words.example: The store has a large stock of shoes.

words.definition: An occupation undertaken for a significant period of a person's life.
words.example: She has a successful career in law.

words.definition: Without being affected by; in spite of.
words.example: Despite the rain, we went outside.

words.definition: At the center; of the greatest importance.
words.example: The library is in a central location.

words.definition: The number 8.
words.example: There are eight planets in the solar system.

words.definition: As a result or consequence of this; therefore.
words.example: He forgot his umbrella, thus he got wet.

words.definition: Medical care given to a patient; the manner in which someone behaves toward or deals with someone or something.
words.example: She needs treatment for her illness.
